title: Great British Bake Off winner David Atherton breaks silence on Instagram
text:
David Atherton crowned Great British Bake Off 2019 winner (Picture: Channel 4)

Great British Bake Off winner David Atherton has finally spoken out after being crowned the 2019 series champion with a heartfelt post on his Instagram.

The fitness fanatic eventually beat Steph Blackwell and Alice Fevronia in a nail-biting finish, landing his first Star Baker title when it really mattered.

Although, thousands of fans slammed the result after David leap-frogged over Steph who took home four Star Baker accolades over the past 10 weeks, while even Alice won two.

Another day, another drama. But not for David who has brushed off the backlash and urged his 60,000 Instagram followers to follow their dreams.

‘Wow, wow, wow, can someone explain to me what just happened? It’s almost exactly 12 months since I applied for Bake Off and this was never in the plan,’ he wrote alongside a particularly chirpy photo of himself clutching on to a rainbow balloon.

‘I didn’t think I’d get through the auditions and now I’m writing this as the winner of series 10. Can people just go for it please, apply for things, push boundaries, but through it all be kind and be yourself.

‘The real prize from this experience was making so many new friends. I know it sounds cheesy, but actually you need support, love and friendship otherwise all this is empty #reachfortheunreachable.’

After his picnic basket won over judges Prue Leith and Paul Hollywood last night, in his victory speech, David told viewers: ‘I have watched this since the second series. For nine years I have been daydreaming about Bake Off, it wasn’t in my mind I could win this.

‘I was always the underdog but I managed to get through.’

Great British Bake Off returns to Channel 4 in 2020.
